alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Craig; Delaware; Mayes; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:59PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Craig, western Delaware, southwestern Ottawa, eastern Mayes and north central Cherokee Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 359 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles north of Vinita to 2 miles northeast of Pensacola to 5 miles south of Locust Grove. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Vinita... Locust Grove... Salina... Afton... Langley... Bernice... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Bluejacket... Disney... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Cherokee State Park... Rose... Spavinaw State Park... Cleora... Chloeta... Strang... Snowdale State Park... Disney Little Blue State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 278 and 297. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
